EXTRACTED VALUE: This was a terrible, terrible idea. [Issue#35]
The platformer has a solid polygon engine and uses the cool cel-shading technique on Buzz on a few other characters.
Proof that the best idea ever on paper translates into B-grade mush. A stinker. [Sept 2007, p.73]
Happy Tree Friends False Alarm is clunky, unimaginative, and more like a false start than a fun game.
We'll go easy on it for being a kids' game, but it's certainly not a good one. [Feb 2008, p.94]
You'll like this game if you like: grainy, blocky, choppy, ugly football.
Are most casual gamers willing to pay 400 Microsoft Points (US$5) for Chess and Checkers? Probably not.
Simply doesn't have what it takes to survive in today's cut-and-thrust market. [Issue #22, p.115]
The result is a techno-soundtracked, particle-effects-spewing mess that's no more fun to watch than it is to play. [Aug 2007, p.83]
